Stephen.text: Apple (of its own choice, not in direct response to a legal case) will allow developers to use payment methods outside the App Store
The 11" iPad Pro gets a mini LED display
Stephen.notes: • This was originally "WWDC 2022 will be virtual", but that was very close to last year's pick, which was within the 365 day limit. It was a borderline judgement, but ultimately they decided they didn't like the precedent.

Stephen.text: The iPad's external display support goes unchanged
Stephen.notes: • Was originally "By December 31, 2022, no Intel Macs will remain on sale as new machines", but this was also too close for comfort, although arguably the previous pick was more permissive than this would have been.

Stephen.text: Apple shows off at least one iOS 16 feature that we havenâ€™t seen before
iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once (reuse)
Stephen.notes:
• Was originally "The Lightning port on the iPhone 14 Pro is upgraded to at least USB 3.0", but it turns out this has been rumored. This prompts a rule change. Stephen thought of a few options which became Flexies, but ultimately opts to reuse Federico's Risky pick from the last game, word for word (a legal choice under the Bill).
  • Federico, oddly, argues for this being correct, with the Dynamic Island allowing multiple app use. But the others agree that, while funny, that isn't it.

Stephen.text: The Apple Watch SE, announced in 2020, moves down in price with no feature changes
Stephen.notes: • Not graded: Series 7 or SE 2 takes the middle price point where the SE is now

Myke.text: Apple releases a new MacBook Air that comes with some colour options not previously available in this product line
The new Mac Pro will be...
Myke.notes:
• "... smaller, not a cube shape, feature no support for the current MPX modules and/or will allow for some form of expandability outside of Thunderbolt. It will be only be available in one color."
  • Another "and/or" added to a pick, which happened a few times this episode. It applies to just the MPX modules and expandability clause.

Myke.text: There will be no iPhone 14 with a 5.4" display
AirPods Max 2 can be folded to store more compactly
Myke.notes: • Myke doesn't seem to have much confidence in this risky pick, but his other choices were shot down as insufficiently risky in negotiations.

Myke.text: At least one iPhone gets an upgraded main camera
At least one iPhone will have the notch removed, replaced by a cut-out(s) for the camera and sensors, free-floating from the border
Myke.notes: • Or, as Stephen so poetically put it, "AKA an island of black glass in an ocean of pixels." Little did he know that Apple would actually call it "the Dynamic Island".

Federico.text: At least one AirPods model will support lossless music playback
iOS 16 brings major changes for systemwide design customization
Federico.notes:
• Also, "Apple will let users choose their own app icons, and they'll introduce new App Store categories for wallpaper and/or icon apps"
  • A reuse and double down of last year's Flexie.

Federico.text: The next generation Apple Watch will have some kind of body temperature sensor
At least one of the next 'Pro' iPhones will have an always-on display
The iPhone 14 Pro Camera app introduces some kind of 3D capturing functionality
There won't be a mini iPhone in the iPhone 14 family
Federico.notes:
• Federico basically steals one of Myke's ongoing annual picks, which is allowed by the rules.
  • ðŸ˜­
